metadata.title: CVE-2016-1953 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in MozillaFirefox before 45.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrarycode via vectors related to js/src/jit/arm/Assembler-arm.cpp, and unknownother vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '45.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
